definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage

sentences.english: The ball game was postponed because of rain.
Postpone the pain, postpone the recovery.
sentences.chinese: 推遲痛苦，就是推遲恢復。

sentences.english: Postpone the pain, postpone the recovery.
sentences.chinese: 推遲痛苦，就是推遲恢復。

sentences.english: The sports meeting to next Friday because of the rain.
sentences.chinese: 由於下雨，這個運功會推遲到下週五。

sentences.english: The cold weather set back the planting by two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 寒冷的天氣使插秧推遲兩個星期。

sentences.english: The judge waived the final decision for 20 days.
We will put off the outing until next week, when we won’t be so busy.
sentences.chinese: 我們把郊遊推遲到下星期，那時我們就不會這兒忙了。

sentences.english: The meeting that night was delayed because one of the members was late.
sentences.chinese: 由於一位作家成員遲到，當晚的會議推遲進行。

sentences.english: Put off living your life until you meet someone.
sentences.chinese: 把享受生活推遲遇到某人之後。

sentences.english: Can I safely defer this decision?
sentences.chinese: 我可以安全地推遲這一決策嗎？

sentences.english: This opposition in the cabinet caused Lincoln to postpone action on the Fox plan.
sentences.chinese: 由於內閣成員的反對導致林肯推遲了實施福克斯計劃。

sentences.english: But Immel says the bank turned over documents dated as late as 2008, Immel says.
sentences.chinese: 但是伊妹兒說美國銀行把日期推遲到了2008年。

sentences.english: Actually we just want to put it off until suppertime.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，我們只是想把這它推遲到晚飯時間。

sentences.english: Mr Wang didn't and the meeting had to be .
sentences.chinese: 王老師遲遲未到，會議只好推遲。

sentences.english: Partly due to the delay, its first-quarter revenue forecast is now below average estimates, according to StarMine.
sentences.chinese: 由於推遲的原因，它的第一季度收入預報低於預期。

sentences.english: Menstruation defers two days, . Can you eat Fu phlogistic health piece?
sentences.chinese: 月經推遲兩天，。能不能喫婦炎康片？

definition: to delay/to postpone/to keep putting sth off/to procrastinate/(computing) to lag
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
as the time draws near/at the last moment/temporary/interim/ad hoc
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
variant of 計劃|计划[ji4 hua4]
to hold a meeting/to attend a meeting
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
